result.execSummary:
The defendant Owen W Masters was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: APPLY ANY BAIL POSTED. COSTS AND DNA PAID IN FULL. Refund remaining bail to poster.
Submit to an AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent.

Maintain absolute sobriety.
Submit to random alcohol/drug screens.
Not to use or possess of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription or any drug paraphernalia.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment/counseling recommended.
Provide DNA sample if not already provided.

timeConds.notes:
Condition Time - First 60 days with huber consecutive to Washington County. Last 30 days STAYED, and to be used at Agent's discretion as well as to huber or straight time. Sentence may be transferred to Washington County. NO ELECTRONIC MONITORING.
Credit for 21 days.

Defendant Owen W Masters in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense counsel is requesting adjournment as they are waiting for his outcome from his Washington County Case. Attorney Schleis makes arguments regarding the defendant's non-compliance letter from WCS. State presents arguments. Court orders him to WCS today to take a drug test and he is to work matters out with them when he is working out of state. Court adjourns the matter.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Owen W Masters in court with attorney Adam J. Schleis.  Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addressed the non-compliance letter from WCS. Attorney Schleis presents statements regarding the letter and stated that his client is going to apply to get into the drug treatment court. Court does not modify the bail today, but does adjourn the matter to see if he does apply for the drug treatment cout and the status of his compliance with WCS.  Hearing scheduled for June 2, 2016 at 09:30 am.
